title: High Unemployment Benefits Adequacy
description: In 2022, Brazil's unemployment benefits and active labor market programs accounted for 27.07% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, indicating a strong social safety net.

title: Significant Public Debt in PNG Bonds
description: As of 2023, Brazil holds a substantial amount of PNG bonds, valued at $3.39 billion, reflecting a significant financial commitment.

title: Low Goods and Services Expense
description: In 2023, Brazil's expenditure on goods and services was only 2.41% of total expenses, indicating efficient spending in this area.

title: Negative Net National Savings
description: In 2021, Brazil's adjusted net national savings were negative, amounting to -$15.90 billion, highlighting a potential area of economic concern.

title: High Rate of Children in Employment
description: In 2015, 95.96% of children aged 7-14 in Brazil were involved in both study and work, indicating a high prevalence of child labor.

title: High Male Child Employment in Study and Work
description: In 2015, 95.8% of male children aged 7-14 were engaged in both study and work, reflecting a significant issue in child labor practices.

title: Low Percentage of Children in Work Only
description: In 2015, only 4.04% of children aged 7-14 were involved in work only, suggesting that most working children also attend school.

title: Low Male Child Employment in Work Only
description: In 2015, just 4.2% of male children aged 7-14 were engaged in work only, indicating that most working boys also pursue education.

title: High Rate of Unpaid Family Workers Among Children
description: In 2015, 63.7% of children in employment aged 7-14 were unpaid family workers, highlighting a significant reliance on child labor within families.
